Detailed Description

Advance Signal Params for the overlays.

struct Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig

Field Documentation

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::acB

AC bias pin frequency RW 0x00 Value (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the AC bias pin. This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge buildup within the display.

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::acBI

AC bias pin transitions per interrupt Value (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC bias pin transitions.

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::hVAlign

Defines the alignment betwwen HSYNC and VSYNC assertion. For valid values see Vps_DssDispcLcdHvAlign

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::hVClkControl

HSYNC/VSYNC pixel clock control on/off. 0x0: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of the pixel clock than pixel data. 0x1: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to hVClkRiseFall value.

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::hVClkRiseFall

Program HSYNC/VSYNC rise or fall 0x0: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on the falling edge of the pixel clock (if hVClkControl is set to 1). 0x1: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on the rising edge of the pixel clock (if hVClkControl is set to 1).

UInt32 Vps_DssDispcLcdAdvSignalConfig::vencId

VencID of the panel to which this config is to be done.
